2019-09-28.abstract: The police used water cannons and tear gas as protesters commemorated the fifth anniversary of the pro-democracy Umbrella Movement, days before a major anniversary in China.
2019-09-28.snippet: The police used water cannons and tear gas as protesters commemorated the fifth anniversary of the pro-democracy Umbrella Movement, days before a major anniversary in China.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Antigovernment protesters in Hong Kong rallied in a downtown park, occupied a major road and blanketed several neighborhoods with pro-democracy artwork on Saturday, days before a sensitive national holiday that will commemorate 70 years of Communist rule in China.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Tens of Thousands Rally in Hong Kong Before China’s National Holiday

2019-09-28.abstract: Britain’s prime minister is being accused of having given undue aid to an American entrepreneur while serving as mayor of London.
2019-09-28.snippet: Britain’s prime minister is being accused of having given undue aid to an American entrepreneur while serving as mayor of London.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A monitor at London’s City Hall has referred Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain to a police watchdog for a possible investigation of claims that he unduly favored an American entrepreneur while mayor of the city, intensifying a politically risky scandal as he faces a hostile Parliament and a looming Brexit deadline.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Police Watchdog Is Asked to Review Boris Johnson’s Ties to U.S. Businesswoman

2019-09-28.abstract: In some cases, yes. But the better question may be: Why don’t you already have it?
2019-09-28.snippet: In some cases, yes. But the better question may be: Why don’t you already have it?
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Q: I’m a renter living in a Midtown co-op, subletting my apartment from a shareholder. The co-op board recently changed its rules, and now requires all shareholders and subletters to purchase renters insurance. But my landlord is the shareholder, not the co-op, so am I really required to follow the co-op’s policy? Since my sublease does not include any requirement about renters insurance, how could my landlord enforce such a rule?
2019-09-28.headline_main: Can My Landlord Force Me to Get Renters Insurance?

2019-09-28.abstract: As life unraveled, a skilled wine steward joined the swelling ranks of homeless people in tents across the San Francisco Bay Area.
2019-09-28.snippet: As life unraveled, a skilled wine steward joined the swelling ranks of homeless people in tents across the San Francisco Bay Area.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Opus One, Château Lynch-Bages or Petrus. The crimson ribbons of fine wine trickled delicately into his customers’ bulbous crystal glasses.
2019-09-28.headline_main: How a Tuxedoed Sommelier Wound Up Homeless in California

2019-09-28.abstract: Make something sweet and seasonal this weekend.
2019-09-28.snippet: Make something sweet and seasonal this weekend.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Cinnamon apple quick bread with apple cider glaze (above) is one of many delicious apple desserts you can tackle this weekend. Try a crumble or a crisp, bake them in a pie or on their own, or get the kids in the kitchen to help with the candied version.
2019-09-28.headline_main: 25 Apple Dessert Recipes Our Readers Love

2019-09-28.abstract: When hurricanes are a part of life, people cope and quell their anxiety through their music.
2019-09-28.snippet: When hurricanes are a part of life, people cope and quell their anxiety through their music.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Every island in the Caribbean has one, if not many: Popular songs inspired by the awful storms that have always been at once facts of life and shapers of history. In this region, from whose indigenous people we got our word — “huracan” — for the fierce tempests that swirl off the Atlantic in late summer and early fall, hurricanes have long been key to culture.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Listen to the Storm Songs of the Caribbean

2019-09-28.abstract: The party is bracing for a pitched battle with President Trump that will likely overshadow its policy agenda. But Democrats say they do not want impeachment to dominate the election.
2019-09-28.snippet: The party is bracing for a pitched battle with President Trump that will likely overshadow its policy agenda. But Democrats say they do not want impeachment to dominate the election.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: After the 2016 election, Democratic leaders reached an all but unanimous conclusion: To defeat President Trump in 2020, they would have to do more than condemn his offensive behavior and far-right ideology, as Hillary Clinton had done. They would need, above all, to promote a clear and exciting agenda of their own.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Democrats’ 2020 Campaign Message: Not Impeachment, They Insist

2019-09-28.abstract: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon remind us that there’s more than one way to solve an acrostic.  As in, you can look things up.
2019-09-28.snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon remind us that there’s more than one way to solve an acrostic.  As in, you can look things up.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: ACROSTIC — Today’s excerpt is by a very funny writer and television personality, Stephen Fry, from his memoirs, “The Fry Chronicles.”  Mr. Fry has a wide range of credits, including a  brainy game show called “Qi” and a lot of work done with wildlife and nature conservation.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Variety: Acrostic

2019-09-28.abstract: Mr. Trudeau came to power by galvanizing young supporters. Keeping them in his corner is critical as he seeks re-election.
2019-09-28.snippet: Mr. Trudeau came to power by galvanizing young supporters. Keeping them in his corner is critical as he seeks re-election.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL — Four years ago Emmanuel Amoussa, a chemistry student, voted for Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada, drawn by what he saw as a young progressive leader whose policies on climate change and immigration resonated with him and other members of his generation.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Justin Trudeau, the Instagram Prime Minister, Struggles to Resonate With Young Voters

2019-09-28.abstract: Where to get a facial, a manicure and even a lymphatic drainage massage in the French capital.
2019-09-28.snippet: Where to get a facial, a manicure and even a lymphatic drainage massage in the French capital.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Parisians have long been viewed as paragons of natural beauty, so much so that the English term “effortless” has been co-opted into their cultural lexicon. Today, though, most locals know that the “I just rolled out of bed” look is often a ruse — one that takes plenty of time and money to perfect. Mussed-up hair is best achieved with the help of France’s top hairstylists, and barefaced, natural beauty is enhanced by stimulating facial massage and a long steam session in one of the city’s many hammams. Here, we’ve compiled a list of the city’s most sought-after beauty experts, brands and salons. Just make sure you book well in advance.
2019-09-28.headline_main: T’s Beauty Guide to Paris

2019-09-28.abstract: To the founding fathers, foreign influence on an American president was an abiding fear and a basis for impeachment.
2019-09-28.snippet: To the founding fathers, foreign influence on an American president was an abiding fear and a basis for impeachment.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Alexander Hamilton, as usual, got right to the heart of the matter. When the framers were designing the Constitution and its power of impeachment, one of the high crimes they had in mind was giving into what Hamilton called “the desire in foreign powers to gain an improper ascendant in our councils.”
2019-09-28.headline_main: Impeachment Battle to Turn for First Time on a President’s Ties to a Foreign Country

2019-09-28.abstract: The founder of the private launch company presented new details about its next major rocket.
2019-09-28.snippet: The founder of the private launch company presented new details about its next major rocket.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: BOCA CHICA VILLAGE, Texas — As Elon Musk, the founder and chief executive of SpaceX, says repeatedly, he created a rocket company because he wanted to colonize Mars. His fervent argument is that humanity must spread to a second planet as insurance for long-term survival.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Elon Musk Sets Out SpaceX Starship’s Ambitious Launch Timeline

2019-09-28.snippet: Whether or not you agree with his jurisprudence, it is rooted in a commitment to black people.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Say the name “Clarence Thomas” in any liberal setting and the response is likely to be short and swift: “self-hating,” “stupid,” “sellout.”
2019-09-28.headline_main: Clarence Thomas Is Not a ‘Sellout’

2019-09-28.abstract: With happiness harder to come by these days, people are grasping at any moment of joy they can get.
2019-09-28.snippet: With happiness harder to come by these days, people are grasping at any moment of joy they can get.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Joy, it seems, is everywhere these days.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Are We Living in a Post-Happiness World?

2019-09-28.abstract: When I set out to become a surfer, I didn’t realize what I was getting myself into.
2019-09-28.snippet: When I set out to become a surfer, I didn’t realize what I was getting myself into.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: San Francisco — The first time I saw a swastika in the wild, I happened to be carrying a surfboard. The year was 1989. I’d just come home from college hungry to claim the California identity that felt like my birthright. I could not have told you what that identity was except that its highest form appeared to be something like a blue-eyed, blond surfer with a golden tan, preternaturally skilled at riding the waves of his native beach.
2019-09-28.headline_main: The Long, Strange Tale of California’s Surf Nazis

2019-09-28.abstract: Neither liberal nor conservative, the true ideology of Silicon Valley is an unwavering belief in the power of technology.
2019-09-28.snippet: Neither liberal nor conservative, the true ideology of Silicon Valley is an unwavering belief in the power of technology.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: What are Silicon Valley’s politics?
2019-09-28.headline_main: The Church of Techno-Optimism

2019-09-28.abstract: I’d love a dining car on the train. Or any chance to slow down.
2019-09-28.snippet: I’d love a dining car on the train. Or any chance to slow down.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: I was covered in a layer of sweat, and my iPhone charger was dangling out of a bag that contained the after-hours work I still needed to do along with a Lara bar, crushed under the weight of my laptop. It should have been obvious: I’d been stressed, and moving way too fast. But, as usual, I didn’t realize it until I was on the train. I poked my head out of my inbox long enough to play peek-a-boo with a toddler clutching her snack, and chat with an older couple en route to vacation. I felt joy, and a familiar pang of shame that comes from realizing you’ve moved too fast to cherish what’s in front of you.
2019-09-28.headline_main: The Sterile, Efficient Life of a Millennial

2019-09-28.abstract: What happens when you mix rage, shame and pride with years of nationalist education?
2019-09-28.snippet: What happens when you mix rage, shame and pride with years of nationalist education?
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Over the past few months, reports on Chinese mainlanders hurling curses at Hong Kong protesters have disturbed people around the world. These self-appointed guardians of Beijing’s authority have appeared in Australia, where they shouted profane insults in Mandarin about the mothers of a group of Hong Kong supporters. In Canada, mainland students driving their Ferraris and Aston Martins to “demonstrate force” derided Hong Kongers as poor and added an expletive for good measure.
2019-09-28.headline_main: The Making of a Chinese Patriot

2019-09-28.abstract: From climate change to Taiwan, China’s foreign policy is about impressing the masses at home, not fighting enemies abroad.
2019-09-28.snippet: From climate change to Taiwan, China’s foreign policy is about impressing the masses at home, not fighting enemies abroad.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: The past few months have been challenging for China: A trade war with the United States has taken a toll on the economy, while months of protests in Hong Kong have raised questions about the sustainability of Chinese political control at the edges of its rule.
2019-09-28.headline_main: ‘Ours Will No Longer Be a Nation Subject to Insult and Humiliation’

2019-09-28.abstract: I’ve learned how to dodge a bullet. But how do you dodge a stroke?
2019-09-28.snippet: I’ve learned how to dodge a bullet. But how do you dodge a stroke?
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: The first time I had a gun pulled on me was a joke. Not to the guy with the shotgun; he was serious enough to park his Cutlass, snatch the shotty out of his trunk and point it at a crew of 11- and 12-year-olds in the street who hadn’t jumped onto the sidewalk fast enough when he beeped at us to move.
2019-09-28.headline_main: I Pray for Murder (Sometimes)

2019-09-28.abstract: Dorian devastated this place, but hope keeps washing ashore.
2019-09-28.snippet: Dorian devastated this place, but hope keeps washing ashore.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: OCRACOKE, N.C. — I write this from a barrier island 26 miles off the mainland coast, accessible only by boat or plane. It has been about three weeks since Hurricane Dorian blew through, tore up and submerged the place that my 1,000 or so neighbors and I call home. While it might seem from a distance that the storm has passed, we are all as shellshocked as we were on Day 1.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Message From a Proud Island: ‘We Need Your Help’

2019-09-28.abstract: Staff Sgt. Richard Ciccarella was sentenced on Friday to three years of probation for making a false statement to a federal officer, court documents said.
2019-09-28.snippet: Staff Sgt. Richard Ciccarella was sentenced on Friday to three years of probation for making a false statement to a federal officer, court documents said.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: A noncommissioned Army officer who was once in charge of White House communications equipment at Mar-a-Lago, President Trump’s private club in Palm Beach, Fla., was sentenced to three years of probation on Friday for lying to a federal officer during a child pornography investigation, court documents show.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Soldier Assigned to Mar-a-Lago Sentenced for Lying in Child Pornography Case

2019-09-28.abstract: How the party revived an ancient philosophy to extol order and compel obedience.
2019-09-28.snippet: How the party revived an ancient philosophy to extol order and compel obedience.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: When Chairman Mao Zedong stepped forward in Tiananmen Square on Oct. 1, 1949, and proclaimed — in standard Chinese but in a thick Hunanese accent — the founding of the People’s Republic of China, many patriots rejoiced. A large number of Chinese who were not Communists were still happy that after years of humiliation by foreign powers, a vicious Japanese invasion and a bloody civil war, China was now finally united. For the first time in roughly a century the Chinese had regained their dignity. Mao was widely credited for this.
2019-09-28.headline_main: The Tenacity of Chinese Communism

2019-09-28.abstract: Dozens of lawmakers have flocked to the southwestern border to see with their own eyes how migrants are being treated. They have come away with little consensus about what needs to be done.
2019-09-28.snippet: Dozens of lawmakers have flocked to the southwestern border to see with their own eyes how migrants are being treated. They have come away with little consensus about what needs to be done.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: EL PASO — The delegation of Democratic lawmakers jostled for space in the cramped room in the border processing center, straining to hear over the sounds of crinkling mylar blankets and a crying baby, as a Venezuelan migrant told her grim story.
2019-09-28.headline_main: At the Border, Lawmakers See a Broken System and Little Common Ground

2019-09-28.abstract: The attacker, who was fatally shot by officers, had a three-inch hunting-type knife, officials said.
2019-09-28.snippet: The attacker, who was fatally shot by officers, had a three-inch hunting-type knife, officials said.

2019-09-28.abstract: An editor at Arizona State University’s student newspaper beat everyone else to the news that Kurt Volker had stepped down.
2019-09-28.snippet: An editor at Arizona State University’s student newspaper beat everyone else to the news that Kurt Volker had stepped down.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: Kurt D. Volker has traveled halfway around the world as a United States diplomat. He has met with world leaders, negotiated foreign policy and served under multiple American presidents.

2019-09-28.abstract: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, will use a military parade commemorating the 70th anniversary of Communist rule to highlight his power in the face of rising challenges.
2019-09-28.snippet: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, will use a military parade commemorating the 70th anniversary of Communist rule to highlight his power in the face of rising challenges.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Enormous flower arrangements in Beijing extol the signature promise of China’s leader to realize the Chinese Dream. Red banners urge people to “rally closer” to the Communist Party with “Comrade Xi Jinping at its core.” The authorities have restricted live entertainment venues, ordered people to vacate apartments and banned flying kites, sky lanterns and even homing pigeons, a charming feature of many neighborhoods.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Tanks, Missiles and No Pigeons: China to Celebrate 70th Birthday of the People’s Republic

2019-09-28.abstract: Details of the push by President Trump and Rudolph Giuliani for Ukraine to investigate Democrats show a sustained effort that encompassed elections in both countries.
2019-09-28.snippet: Details of the push by President Trump and Rudolph Giuliani for Ukraine to investigate Democrats show a sustained effort that encompassed elections in both countries.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Petro O. Poroshenko was still the president of Ukraine earlier this year when his team sought a lifeline. With the polls showing him in clear danger of losing his re-election campaign, some of his associates, eager to hold on to their own jobs and influence, took steps that could have yielded a signal of public support from a vital ally: President Trump.
2019-09-28.headline_main: How a Shadow Foreign Policy in Ukraine Prompted an Impeachment Inquiry

2019-09-28.abstract: Tom McCoy’s Sunday puzzle tips the scales.
2019-09-28.snippet: Tom McCoy’s Sunday puzzle tips the scales.
2019-09-28.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Tom McCoy is a steady Sunday grid contributor who specializes in creative pun interpretation, as well as this type of puzzle, where he finds a quirk in the English language and spins it out to entertaining effect. Fittingly, Mr. McCoy is in a Ph.D. program in cognitive science at Johns Hopkins, specializing in computational linguistics.
2019-09-28.headline_main: Now Weight Just a Second

2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: ARTS & LEISUREThis weekend’s cover article about Eddie Murphy’s new projects misstates the number of children he has. He has 10 children, not eight.•A picture caption with an article last Sunday about the new “Downton Abbey” movie misidentified the man who is dancing with the actress Michelle Dockery. He is the actor Matthew Goode — not Henry Talbot, who is Goode’s character.•A museum entry in the listings pages of the New Season issue on Sept. 15 about “Betye Saar: Call and Response” at LACMA referred incorrectly to the exhibition. It is a show, not a retrospective.

2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: SOWETO, South Africa — Nomsa Victorino had a Lexus in her garage, a pool in her yard, eight bedrooms in her villa and a message for the world about her famous hometown. “Whatever people have in their mind about Soweto — that Soweto is a place for poor people — it’s not like that,” said Ms. Victorino, 50, sitting in one of her three sitting rooms. “It has changed drastically.”

The world’s oldest travel company just closed in Britain, putting about 21,000 people out of work. There’s so much nervousness about a looming recession, the ’70s seem to be all any designer can think about (followed by that other recessionary decade, the ’90s).

2019-09-29.abstract: Roast chicken with plums, short ribs with prunes and almonds, a Parmesan broth with greens and beans: Set yourself up for days of good eating.
2019-09-29.snippet: Roast chicken with plums, short ribs with prunes and almonds, a Parmesan broth with greens and beans: Set yourself up for days of good eating.
2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Rosh Hashana celebrations will take place for some after services this evening, for others after services on Monday night and for a few on both nights, happy new year. If you’re in the first camp or just want something good to eat tonight, I’m thinking Melissa Clark’s recipe for roast chicken with plums (above). If you’re in the second or just want something good to eat on Monday night that benefits from an overnight sit in the refrigerator, try these awesome short ribs braised with prunes and almonds, from Joan Nathan, whom I think of fondly as America’s Jewish mom.
2019-09-29.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2019-09-29.abstract: Collaborations have flourished in the wake of “Despacito,” some sounding natural, some sounding forced.
2019-09-29.snippet: Collaborations have flourished in the wake of “Despacito,” some sounding natural, some sounding forced.
2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, the remix of Luis Fonsi’s “Despacito” featuring Justin Bieber became one of the defining pop songs of the decade, spending 16 weeks atop the Billboard Hot 100 and radically shifting how Spanish-language pop moved in the American mainstream. Reggaeton and its many offshoots were outrageously popular in Spanish-speaking markets, and the success of “Despacito” suggested that English-speaking audiences were finally open to it as well.
2019-09-29.headline_main: A New Flood of English-Spanish Pop Is Here. Is It Opportunism or Progress?

2019-09-29.abstract: Shaking the rigid ideologies that have defined Israel’s politics.
2019-09-29.snippet: Shaking the rigid ideologies that have defined Israel’s politics.
2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: The inconclusive results of Israel’s Sept. 17 election have thrust Israeli politics into a gripping deadlock. The center-left has no way to form a coalition, but for the first time in many years, neither does the right. This political paralysis reflects a profound change sweeping Israeli society in the last decade in the debate about the conflict.
2019-09-29.headline_main: How an Israeli Unity Government Could Shrink the Conflict

2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: Andrew Gaare, a 25-year-old “big time” Mets fan, spent this season watching games from a perch behind center field. He is an Amazin’ Mets ballpark pass subscriber, so he can go to as many home games as he wants for $40 a month. There’s just one catch: His ticket is for standing room only with no assigned seat.

2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: This summer, readers of the Estonian puzzle magazine “Nuti” were asked to vote on a new capital — but not to worry, this did not constitute a cruciverbal coup. The vote was based on 10 towns and villages with short names that come up frequently in the country’s crosswords, and was the idea of Kaarel Silmato, a “Nuti” editor.
2019-09-29.headline_main: How the Tiny Village of Aa Became Estonia’s New ‘National Capital.’ Sort of.

2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: Calling all parents with pets! The only thing cuter than a pet or a baby is a pet and a baby. However, taking care of both isn’t always easy, which is NYT Parenting has a guide on how to introduce your newborn baby to your furry or feathered one. And, we want to see them together. Send us photos of your pets alongside your bundles of joy (or chaos, depending on the day), and we’ll feature some of the best images here and on our Instagram account (@NYTParenting).
2019-09-29.headline_main: We’re Looking for the Cutest Photos of Pets and Babies

2019-09-29.abstract: What does it mean for us that birds are dying? And what can we do about it?
2019-09-29.snippet: What does it mean for us that birds are dying? And what can we do about it?
2019-09-29.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — During the nearly quarter-century that my family has lived in this house, the changes in our neighborhood have become increasingly apparent: fewer trees and wildflowers, fewer bees and butterflies and grasshoppers, fewer tree frogs and songbirds. The vast majority of Tennessee is still rural, and for years I told myself that such changes were merely circumstantial, specific to a city undergoing rapid gentrification and explosive growth. I wasn’t trying to save the world by putting up nest boxes for the birds or letting the wildflowers in my yard bloom out before mowing. I was hoping only to provide a small way station for migrating wildlife, trusting they would be fine once they cleared the affluence zone that is the New Nashville.
2019-09-29.headline_main: Three Billion Canaries in the Coal Mine

2019-09-30.abstract: A classic crime film is new to the Criterion Channel. And a documentary about Franco’s legacy in Spain debuts on PBS.
2019-09-30.snippet: A classic crime film is new to the Criterion Channel. And a documentary about Franco’s legacy in Spain debuts on PBS.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: LE SAMOURAÏ (1967) Stream on the Criterion Channel. Rent on Amazon, Google Play, iTunes, Vudu and YouTube. In Jean-Pierre Melville’s seminal crime film, Alain Delon plays Jef Costello, a highly disciplined hit man whose life is disrupted when he is seen leaving the scene after killing a nightclub owner. He’s saved from immediate prosecution when the club’s piano player, Valérie (Cathy Rosier), refuses to cooperate with the police. The film reveals little of Costello’s inner life or Valérie’s motivations. These mysteries deepen as the investigation continues and Costello’s ruthless employer circles. Even the film’s violent ending, which seems to promise some resolution, only reinforces its central enigmas.
2019-09-30.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘Le Samouraï’ and ‘The Silence of Others’

2019-09-30.abstract: After meddling in the 2016 American election, Russia is using similar tactics in the Central African Republic. But as it sows political chaos, this time it is also seeking diamonds.

2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: As Max the First neared his 17th birthday, we knew his days were numbered. He approached the wrong side of the door to go out and often started to pee in the vestibule, a common sign of cognitive impairment. Long walks — and sometimes any walks — were now out of the question.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Keeping an Older Dog Vibrant

2019-09-30.snippet: Over the last month, Justice Sonia Sotomayor has issued three opinions describing flaws in the capital justice system.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The terse Supreme Court rulings arrived in the evening, in time to allow an execution later that night. There were three rulings in the last month or so, at 5:52 p.m., at 7:01 p.m. and at 10:13 p.m. They were bland and formulaic, saying only that the court had denied an “application for stay of execution of sentence of death.” The inmates who had filed the applications were put to death within hours.
2019-09-30.headline_main: In Death Penalty Cases, Sotomayor Is Alone in ‘Bearing Witness’

2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: “Fight the Landlord” is one of the most popular card games in China. The name comes from the 1950s, when the Chinese Communist Party confiscated property from landowners, often violently, in the name of the masses. As many as two million people were killed.

2019-09-30.snippet: Trump has given them another chance to break away. Why won’t they take it?
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: In a sane world, the reaction of Republicans to the “memorandum of telephone conversation” between President Trump and the president of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelensky, combined with the whistle-blower complaint filed by an intelligence officer describing a White House cover-up, would be similar to the response of Republicans after the release, on Aug. 5, 1974, of the “smoking gun” tape that finally broke the Nixon presidency. Republicans would begin to abandon Mr. Trump, with senior figures urging him in private and in public to resign.
2019-09-30.headline_main: What’s the Matter With Republicans?

Then he scented it with Blood and Money and Petrol (after starting with a bit of Anti-Sceptic, literally: he had perfumes made for the show) — the engines that drive the world’s rotting power structures — and a low thrum began.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Blood, Money, Oil. And Clothes.

2019-09-30.abstract: Knowing the answer might force us toward a real solution.
2019-09-30.snippet: Knowing the answer might force us toward a real solution.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: If the summer heat, followed by Hurricane Dorian, hasn’t convinced you that climate change is real, probably nothing will. Those of us convinced will want to mitigate it if we can. Doing that requires understanding the different kinds of problems climate change presents. They are economic, political and philosophical. The three kinds of problems are inextricably intertwined. That’s one lesson taught by the relatively new discipline of politics, philosophy and economics (PPE).
2019-09-30.headline_main: What Kind of Problem Is Climate Change?

2019-09-30.abstract: Akwaeke Emezi’s “Pet” tells the story of a trans girl who knows that evil is still lurking, even when her utopian society sees only angels.
2019-09-30.snippet: Akwaeke Emezi’s “Pet” tells the story of a trans girl who knows that evil is still lurking, even when her utopian society sees only angels.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: “We are each other’s harvest.” For the people of the fictional city of Lucille, these words, written by the poet Gwendolyn Brooks in homage to the great Paul Robeson, are the battle cry of their revolution. “We are each other’s business; we are each other’s magnitude and bond,” the verse continues. In Akwaeke Emezi’s beautiful, genre-expanding debut young adult novel, PET (203 pp., Make Me a World, $17.99; ages 12 and up) — a finalist for a National Book Award — the lines serve as both a clarion call and a reminder that utopian communities like Lucille are not only created, they must be fought for and maintained.
2019-09-30.headline_main: In This Genre-Bending Novel, You Better Believe the Monsters Are Real

2019-09-30.abstract: A trifecta of climate change, hydropower dams and illegal fishing are threatening the Tonle Sap, and the people who rely on its fish.
2019-09-30.snippet: A trifecta of climate change, hydropower dams and illegal fishing are threatening the Tonle Sap, and the people who rely on its fish.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: When I first met Ly Heng in May 2016, the forest behind his house was still smoldering — the remnants of the worst drought to hit Southeast Asia in decades. Heng lived along a small river at the top of Cambodia’s Tonle Sap Lake, in a protected area known for its rich biodiversity. At 45, he had never seen wildfires, and never seen the water level of the lake dip so low. Charred sticks and leaves crunched underfoot while Heng led me through the woodland, recounting his neighbors’ efforts to keep the fire from incinerating their houses.
2019-09-30.headline_main: At a Cambodian Lake, a Climate Crisis Unfolds

2019-09-30.abstract: Hundreds of black citizens were killed in Elaine, Ark., a century ago this week.
2019-09-30.snippet: Hundreds of black citizens were killed in Elaine, Ark., a century ago this week.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: One hundred years ago this week, one of the worst episodes of racial violence in American history unfolded in Elaine, Ark., a small town on the Mississippi. Details remain difficult to verify. The perpetrators suppressed coverage of the events, and the victims, terrified black families, had no one to turn for help. In fact, local police were complicit in the killing of untold numbers of African-Americans.
2019-09-30.headline_main: The Forgotten History of America’s Worst Racial Massacre

2019-09-30.abstract: The conflict turns messier, and everyday life suffers, as  the disputed territory remains on lock down. Here are images from the front lines of the Kashmir crisis.
2019-09-30.snippet: The conflict turns messier, and everyday life suffers, as  the disputed territory remains on lock down. Here are images from the front lines of the Kashmir crisis.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: For nearly two months, the flash-point region of Kashmir has been locked down. The Indian government has flooded it with troops. The internet has been cut off. Mobile phones don’t work.Soldiers have ordered people to stay inside their homes or they will be shot. Anti-government militants have killed and threatened civilians as well. People can’t get to the hospital, they can’t communicate with loved ones, they can’t go to school or work. Everyday life has been paralyzed. This all began Aug. 5 when India announced stunning news: It was stripping Jammu and Kashmir state, India’s only Muslim-majority state, of the autonomy it had held since the 1940s. The territory will soon be cut in half and each piece will become a federal enclave.The Indian government, which is controlled by a popular Hindu nationalist political party, says these moves are necessary to bring peace to Kashmir. For decades, the region has been racked by unrest, rebellion, warfare and bloodshed. Pakistan, India’s rival, also claims parts of Kashmir and is accused of stirring up an anti-India insurgency.Indian officials knew that stripping Kashmir’s statehood would be deeply unpopular. And the Kashmir Valley, the most restive part of the state and home to as many as 8 million people, remains under a punishing blockade.
2019-09-30.headline_main: In Kashmir, Growing Anger and Misery

2019-09-30.abstract: John R. Bolton, the former national security adviser, did not use President Trump’s name but was nonetheless critical of his former boss’s strategy.

2019-09-30.snippet: The pharmacy chains are pulling the heartburn medication from shelves after the Food and Drug Administration warned that it had detected low levels of a cancer-causing chemical in samples of the drug.

2019-09-30.abstract: She’s still among the very last generation of movie actors for whom stardom and skill seem scarily, thrillingly natural.
2019-09-30.snippet: She’s still among the very last generation of movie actors for whom stardom and skill seem scarily, thrillingly natural.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: I keep a file on my phone labeled Wellness. It’s got zero fitness tips and no meditation advice. It’s full, instead, of stuff about Gwyneth Paltrow movies. Like how, in “A Perfect Murder,” she buys Viggo Mortensen a fancy espresso maker and tells him, “You could use a little civilizing.” I called my Paltrow file Wellness because, last year, I thought it’d be amusing to find some overlap between her acting and Goop, her lifestyle brand. How many times had a Paltrow character tried to upgrade the lives of the people around her, just as a matter of taste, like that espresso machine or the matchmaking she tries to do in “Emma”?
2019-09-30.headline_main: I Love Gwyneth Paltrow. There. I Said It.

2019-09-30.abstract: Andy Brennan, a cidermaker in the Hudson Valley, has written a how-to of sorts on his craft.
2019-09-30.snippet: Andy Brennan, a cidermaker in the Hudson Valley, has written a how-to of sorts on his craft.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: Should you have any thought of creating an apple orchard and making craft cider to sell, your first year’s efforts are likely to run $27,755. That’s what Andy Brennan, who co-owns Aaron Burr Cider in Wurtsboro, N.Y., calculated in his biographical book on the subject. What’s most interesting about this very readable volume is how he got started by foraging apples in the Catskills. He explains the wild apple, how cider is made and compares step-by-step cidermaking with conventionally grown (commercial) apples, natural (untreated) apples and noncultivated (wild fruit). Along the way there’s a history of apples, especially in colonial America.
2019-09-30.headline_main: The Book for Cider Lovers

2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: Andrew Tarlow, the Brooklyn restaurateur, should think about making or selling cheese to go with his bread company, She Wolf, and his newly opened Williamsburg wine shop, Stranger Wines. As with most small niche wine shops these days, the terms “natural” and “organic” are front and center, along with orange wines from many countries. “We care about the land and the farmers,” Mr. Tarlow said. “This is a natural extension of what I do in the restaurants.” The shop is as spare as a Shaker meeting room; its shelves hold bottles mostly priced at less than $100. For now, it sells some name-brand spirits, not just the craft stuff, an inventory bought with the store. Thanks to his partner in the venture — Dennis McNany, a musician, artist and former manager of Uva in the neighborhood who goes by DJ — there’s a busy vinyl playlist.

2019-09-30.abstract: The family and classmates of Channing Smith, a high school junior, said his death was a result of “social media bullying” and called for a thorough investigation.
2019-09-30.snippet: The family and classmates of Channing Smith, a high school junior, said his death was a result of “social media bullying” and called for a thorough investigation.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: The family and classmates of a Tennessee high school student who killed himself after being outed online as bisexual have demanded that the school and state authorities investigate and prosecute those responsible, calling it a case of “social media bullying.”
2019-09-30.headline_main: A Teenager Killed Himself After Being Outed as Bisexual. His Family Wants Justice.

2019-09-30.abstract: A multiple Grammy Award winner, she was a towering figure on operatic, concert and recital stages.
2019-09-30.snippet: A multiple Grammy Award winner, she was a towering figure on operatic, concert and recital stages.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: Jessye Norman, the majestic American soprano who brought a sumptuous, shimmering voice to a broad range of roles at the Metropolitan Opera and houses around the world, died on Monday in New York. She was 74.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Jessye Norman, Regal American Soprano, Is Dead at 74

2019-09-30.abstract: Why do they hate her? It’s mainly about their egos.
2019-09-30.snippet: Why do they hate her? It’s mainly about their egos.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: Remember when pundits used to argue that Elizabeth Warren wasn’t likable enough to be president? It was always a lazy take, with a strong element of sexism. And it looks ridiculous now, watching Warren on the campaign trail. Never mind whether she’s someone you’d like to have a beer with, she’s definitely someone thousands of people want to take selfies with.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Warren Versus the Petty Plutocrats

2019-09-30.abstract: Two clinical trials show that using a single inhaler with three drugs may help people whose asthma is difficult to treat.
2019-09-30.snippet: Two clinical trials show that using a single inhaler with three drugs may help people whose asthma is difficult to treat.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: Many people with asthma use inhalers to control the chronic inflammation in their lungs. But for those with more severe forms of the disease, the standard inhaled medication may not be enough to keep the wheezing, chest tightness and attacks at bay.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Asthma 3-in-1 Therapy May Improve Lung Function, Study Shows

2019-09-30.abstract: Over the past week, the president has accused Democratic lawmakers of lying and hypocrisy on dealings with Ukraine. Here are the facts behind his claims.
2019-09-30.snippet: Over the past week, the president has accused Democratic lawmakers of lying and hypocrisy on dealings with Ukraine. Here are the facts behind his claims.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: President Trump was referring to statements made by Representative Adam B. Schiff, Democrat of California, during a congressional hearing last week about the July 25 phone call between Mr. Trump and the president of Ukraine. That call is part of a whistle-blower complaint that led Democrats to begin an impeachment hearing.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Examining Trump’s Claims About Democrats and Ukraine

2019-09-30.abstract: The indictment revealed that the United States ran a double-agent spy operation, passing along phony “national security information” on digital memory cards to Beijing.
2019-09-30.snippet: The indictment revealed that the United States ran a double-agent spy operation, passing along phony “national security information” on digital memory cards to Beijing.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: The United States ran a double-agent operation against China’s Ministry of State Security, an indictment unsealed in California revealed on Monday, as it announced that it had arrested an American citizen and charged him with smuggling what he thought were classified American secrets to China’s leading intelligence agency.
2019-09-30.headline_main: California Man Charged With Smuggling Fabricated U.S. Secrets to China

2019-09-30.abstract: What began as trollish shorthand for political polarization has gone mainstream.
2019-09-30.snippet: What began as trollish shorthand for political polarization has gone mainstream.
2019-09-30.lead_paragraph: As outlandish and extreme as it is, warning of a looming civil war is a familiar talking point across the pro-Trump media. It’s part of a growing tradition of right-wing fearmongering — what Vox’s Dylan Matthews referred to last year as “apocalypse punditry” — that moves easily from the online fever swamps to the Oval Office and back again.
2019-09-30.headline_main: Why Trump Tweeted About Civil War
